alert.note: Alert for Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Georgia, including the following county, Hart. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, greenways,low-water crossings, underpasses, urbanized areas, and low-lying roadways and parking lots. High flows over low-water crossings and low-lying roadways are possible and water may approach low-lying structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hartwell, Reed Creek, Bowersville, Lake Hartwell, Nuberg and Vanna.
